getPhraseText: Jeff , let me just ask you what went through your mind when the press secretary , you know , said what she said.
You know that she's just , you know , amazed to be in a room where people want to keep churches closed.
E thought tone in your voice was pretty clear.
You you're dying to go back to church.
Well , I happen to be somebody who goes to church , and it felt very much like she was giving a broad brush statement about everyone in that room.
And the truth is , we were in that room and are every day to ask questions and to get to the to the truth , to get to the the facts behind these decisions.
And the president didn't address that.
Kayleigh didn't address it by good questioning or under good questioning from my colleagues.
And then she made that sort of broad brush statement that we all don't want churches and synagogues and mosques to be open , and it's just it's just simply not true.
And a lot of people in that room are people who go to those places of worship and would like to go back.
